2. Configuration Guide

This guide covers all configuration options for the UTM Campus Assistant system.

2.1. Environment Variables

2.1.1. Core Configuration

Required Environment Variables

Variable

Default

Description

SESSION_SECRET

None

Flask session encryption key (required)

DATABASE_URL

sqlite:///utm_campus.db

Database connection string

DEEPSEEK_API_URL

http://localhost:11434/v1/chat/completions

AI service endpoint

DEEPSEEK_MODEL

deepseek-r1:7b

AI model identifier

2.1.2. Application Settings

# Flask Configuration
FLASK_ENV=production
FLASK_DEBUG=false

# Database Settings
SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS=false
SQLALCHEMY_ECHO=false

# Security Settings
SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE=true
SESSION_COOKIE_HTTPONLY=true
SESSION_COOKIE_SAMESITE=Lax

2.2. Database Configuration

2.2.1. SQLite Configuration

Default configuration for development and small deployments:

SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = 'sqlite:///utm_campus.db'
SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS = {
    'pool_recycle': 300,
    'pool_pre_ping': True,
}

2.2.2. PostgreSQL Configuration

For production deployments with high load:

DATABASE_URL=postgresql://username:password@localhost:5432/utm_campus

SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS = {
    'pool_size': 10,
    'pool_recycle': 3600,
    'pool_pre_ping': True,
    'max_overflow': 20
}

2.3. AI Service Configuration

2.3.1. Local DeepSeek Setup

Configure for local AI service:

DEEPSEEK_API_URL=http://localhost:11434/v1/chat/completions
DEEPSEEK_MODEL=deepseek-r1:7b
DEEPSEEK_TIMEOUT=30
DEEPSEEK_MAX_RETRIES=3

2.3.2. OpenAI Configuration

Alternative AI service configuration:

OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
OPENAI_MODEL=gpt-4
OPENAI_MAX_TOKENS=1000

2.4. Security Configuration

2.4.1. Session Security

# Session configuration
PERMANENT_SESSION_LIFETIME = timedelta(hours=8)
SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = True
SESSION_COOKIE_HTTPONLY = True
SESSION_COOKIE_SAMESITE = 'Lax'

2.4.2. Password Security

# Password hashing configuration
BCRYPT_LOG_ROUNDS = 12
PASSWORD_MIN_LENGTH = 8
PASSWORD_REQUIRE_SPECIAL = True

2.5. Logging Configuration

2.5.1. Application Logging

import logging

logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.INFO,
    format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(name)s %(message)s',
    handlers=[
        logging.FileHandler('utm_campus.log'),
        logging.StreamHandler()
    ]
)

2.5.2. Log Levels

Log Levels

Level

Usage

DEBUG

Development debugging

INFO

General information

WARNING

Warning messages

ERROR

Error conditions

CRITICAL

Critical failures

2.6. Performance Configuration

2.6.1. Cache Settings

# Facility cache configuration
FACILITY_CACHE_TIMEOUT = 3600  # 1 hour
AI_RESPONSE_CACHE = True
CACHE_TYPE = 'simple'

2.6.2. Database Optimization

# Query optimization
SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS = {
    'pool_size': 20,
    'pool_recycle': 3600,
    'pool_pre_ping': True,
    'echo': False,
    'echo_pool': False
}

2.7. File Upload Configuration

2.7.1. Upload Settings

# File upload configuration
MAX_CONTENT_LENGTH = 16 * 1024 * 1024  # 16MB
UPLOAD_FOLDER = 'uploads'
ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS = {'png', 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'gif', 'pdf', 'doc', 'docx'}

2.7.2. Storage Configuration

# File storage paths
STATIC_FOLDER=static
UPLOAD_FOLDER=uploads
BACKUP_FOLDER=backups

2.8. Email Configuration

2.8.1. SMTP Settings

# Email configuration
MAIL_SERVER=smtp.utm.my
MAIL_PORT=587
MAIL_USE_TLS=true
MAIL_USERNAME=utm-campus-assistant@utm.my
MAIL_PASSWORD=your-email-password

2.8.2. Email Templates

Configure email notifications:

# Email settings
MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER = 'UTM Campus Assistant <noreply@utm.my>'
MAIL_SUBJECT_PREFIX = '[UTM Campus] '

2.9. Backup Configuration

2.9.1. Database Backup

# Backup settings
BACKUP_SCHEDULE=daily
BACKUP_RETENTION_DAYS=30
BACKUP_LOCATION=/backups/utm_campus

2.9.2. Automated Backups

# Cron job for daily backups
0 2 * * * /path/to/backup_script.sh

2.10. Monitoring Configuration

2.10.1. Health Check Settings

# Health monitoring
HEALTH_CHECK_INTERVAL = 300  # 5 minutes
HEALTH_CHECK_ENDPOINTS = [
    '/health',
    '/api/status',
    '/db/ping'
]

2.10.2. Metrics Collection

# Metrics configuration
METRICS_ENABLED = True
METRICS_ENDPOINT = '/metrics'
METRICS_RETENTION_DAYS = 90

2.11. Development Configuration

2.11.1. Debug Settings

# Development environment
FLASK_ENV=development
FLASK_DEBUG=true
SQLALCHEMY_ECHO=true
LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG

2.11.2. Testing Configuration

# Test database
TEST_DATABASE_URL = 'sqlite:///:memory:'
TESTING = True
WTF_CSRF_ENABLED = False

2.12. Production Configuration

2.12.1. Optimization Settings

# Production environment
FLASK_ENV=production
FLASK_DEBUG=false
SQLALCHEMY_ECHO=false
LOG_LEVEL=INFO

2.12.2. Security Hardening

# Production security
SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = True
PREFERRED_URL_SCHEME = 'https'
FORCE_HTTPS = True

2.13. Configuration Validation

2.13.1. Required Settings Check

Create a validation script:

def validate_config():
    required_vars = [
        'SESSION_SECRET',
        'DATABASE_URL'
    ]

    for var in required_vars:
        if not os.getenv(var):
            raise ValueError(f"Missing required environment variable: {var}")

2.14. Configuration Templates

2.14.1. Development Template

# .env.development
SESSION_SECRET=dev-secret-key-change-in-production
DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///utm_campus_dev.db
FLASK_ENV=development
FLASK_DEBUG=true
DEEPSEEK_API_URL=http://localhost:11434/v1/chat/completions
DEEPSEEK_MODEL=deepseek-r1:7b

2.14.2. Production Template

# .env.production
SESSION_SECRET=secure-random-key-here
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@localhost/utm_campus
FLASK_ENV=production
FLASK_DEBUG=false
DEEPSEEK_API_URL=https://api.deepseek.com/v1/chat/completions
DEEPSEEK_MODEL=deepseek-r1:7b

2.15. Best Practices

2.15.1. Security Best Practices

  1. Never commit secrets to version control

  2. Use strong, unique session secrets

  3. Enable HTTPS in production

  4. Regularly rotate API keys

  5. Monitor access logs

2.15.2. Performance Best Practices

  1. Use connection pooling

  2. Enable query caching

  3. Optimize database queries

  4. Monitor resource usage

  5. Use CDN for static assets

2.15.3. Configuration Management

  1. Use environment-specific configs

  2. Document all configuration options

  3. Validate configuration on startup

  4. Use configuration management tools

  5. Backup configuration files
